summary: This document is an email chain from September 2019 between U.S. Attorney's Office personnel, forwarding unsolicited communications from an unidentified individual referencing the Epstein case. The emails indicate the sender is not a victim or witness, and the correspondence is being shared internally as a routine matter.

persons.name: Eric
persons.context: Addressed in an email from Alex regarding unsolicited communications about the Epstein case.

persons.name: Alex
persons.context: Author of an email forwarding unsolicited communications about the Epstein case to a colleague, noting the sender is not a victim or witness.

connections.description: Colleagues within the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, with Alex forwarding case-related information to Eric.

events.title: Forwarding of unsolicited emails
events.description: Alex receives and forwards two emails from an unidentified individual referencing the Epstein case to colleague Eric.

events.title: Follow-up forwarding
events.description: An email is sent forwarding an attachment, referencing the same individual as before.

events.title: Final forwarding email
events.description: An email is sent stating 'Hey same person as before, just sending along per usual,' indicating routine handling of communications.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York was receiving unsolicited communications about the Epstein case in August-September 2019.
The communications were from an unidentified individual who was explicitly noted as not being a victim or witness in the case.
The email chain shows a routine internal process for handling such civilian contacts during the investigation.
